page.title: 07Drayton Village
page.content: Drayton straddles the Abingdon to Steventon road,the B 4017,about two and a half miles south of Abingdon.It was part of Berkshire until 1974 when reorganisation of county boundaries resulted in it becoming part of the Vale of the White Horse district of Oxfordshire.To the east of the road lie older village houses built mainly of local brick.To the west of the road are modern housing estates,private and council,the new Drayton Village Hall, built in 1975 and Drayton Primary School,built in the 1950s.The population of Drayton is now approximately 2,600,having increased from the first 1801 census of 484.The village in 1801 was an agricultural village but is now becoming a dormitory for people working in Oxford,Abingdon,Harwell and Culham. There are now only two working farms.
